meanings.definition: The action of pulling or tearing away forcibly.
meanings.sent1: The avulsions of the bandage caused pain to the patient.
meanings.sent2: The avulsions of the tree roots made the ground uneven.
meanings.sent3: The avulsions of the curtain during the play startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The avulsions of trust in their relationship left deep scars.
meanings.sent5: The avulsions of the old wallpaper revealed a hidden message.

meanings.definition: The sudden removal of soil by a flowing stream.
meanings.sent1: The avulsions of the riverbank changed the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The avulsions of soil near the creek were evident after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The avulsions of dirt by the stream created a mini mudslide.
meanings.sent4: The avulsions of earth by the water resembled a miniature canyon.
meanings.sent5: The avulsions of sediment by the current exposed layers of rock.
